Reviews.Title: “excellent location, price and quality”
Reviews.Author: Ann162
Reviews.Content: This hotel has excellent rooms located very close to a train station. The staff are friendly and helpful. Very good value for money too.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MarySElgin
Reviews.Content: Fifteen minute walk to Alexanderplatz, the museum island or the centre of Berlin. Underground station on the street across from the hotel. The hotel was clean and comfortable, the staff efficient and friendly. Original works of art on the walls. We got a good price for the six nights we were there but the cost of food and drink was high. Better to eat elsewhere! Lots of bars/cafes within walking distance and the transport system in Berlin is easy and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andy T
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us, really friendly staff, clean quiet room and right in the centre of Berlin. Breakfast was a little limited for vegetarians but the free wifi was a great touch.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: julesirelandeire
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed in this hotel 3 nights in April 12. Very clean, modern, warm and receptionists were really firendly. The only downside was the location - it is a little way out from the main thoroughfare although the U bahn is just outside the front door. I would have no problem staying here again but I think I would prefer to be nearer the main area. The breakfast is a little pricey at 16 euros which we didn't avail of. Our room was on the 1st floor to the back and no noise problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: crags72
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel, modern decor and very friendly staff. Centrally located within easy reach of Unter Den Linden and a U-bahn outside the door. The reception staff were very helpful and the bar staff very friendly and attentive. We stayed at the front of the hotel and the windows were great - they kept all the noise out. We had a bar snack one night and the portions were very big and at a reasonable price for a city centre hotel. Minus points - we thought brekkie was a bit pricey at 16 euros so didn't bother and the room was very warm at night, the aircon seemed to make it hotter but these are very minor quibbles. We enjoyed our stay here and wouldn't hesitate to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “More minus than plus….”
Reviews.Author: JAEMH
Reviews.Content: This Arthotel is a max. 15 minutes walk away from the Cathedral in East Berlin. The price (aprox. 85 euro for a double room pro night) was the reason for us to stay at this place. There are minus and plus points. Just read below and make your own decision…. Minus: - rooms at the front/street side are very noisy (especially at 05.00 in the morning when the busses start warming up). Tip: Ask at any time for a room at the backside. - breakfast and lunch in the hotel restaurant are very expensive (e.g. 16 euro for breakfast buffet). - Reception staff is also responsible for answering the phone. This result is many disturbances while they are fulfilling reception tasks.. - Reception staff is not able to make any restaurant recommendations. They will always point out a certain neighbourhood but not a specific place, which is maybe a policy of the hotel? - The direct neighbourhood of the hotel is not very impressive - There is free internet (with vouchers) but with a very slow signal (why do they otherwise also offer a business version which is not free?) Plus: - OK bikes for rent (10 euro pro day) - Friendly (very young) staff - Decent rooms

Reviews.Title: “Really nice junior suites”
Reviews.Author: Katharina R
Reviews.Content: The junior suites have a big balkony where you have a great view over Berlin mitte. From our room we could actually se the TV tower from our bed. There are no bars/restaurants or interesting shops in the direct area of the hotel (the area is a bit boring), but it is easy to get to the metro and around.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet, chick place for business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Louis B
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay was great! Loved the concept and design. Cant believe that the building use to be a youth hostile. Please note that rooms are really warm, use AC if works! And at breakfast, be carefull, they count how many croissants you eat!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and helpful staff, but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: principessa320
Reviews.Content: I agree that the property is well maintained and the staff are very helpful. Our room was very clean and not too small (nothing fancy but no problems either), and the bed was comfortable. The staff were all extremely helpful in giving directions, suggestions on sites to visit, calling taxis, etc. The only downside is the location, if you are the type of person who likes to have restaurants, cafes and shops within a short walking distance. There is nothing on the surrounding streets, which is inconvenient if you don't want to have a 16 euro breakfast at the hotel, for instance. But no complaints at all about the hotel itself - I recommend it for a short stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this modern but cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChippyScotland
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and would definitely stay again. We booked in for 2 nights over New Year and had a great time in Berlin. The location of this hotel is fab as the city is so spread out you need to be central and near a U Bahn, which this hotel is. Being on a quiet street is an advantage as you are in the midst of it but are not bothered by noise at all. The rooms are cosy and warm but still really modern. Staff are very helpful and friendly, the bar area is v cool - shame that it wasn't busier as I think this would be a great place to have a few drinks before heading out. All in all a fantastic hotel for the price which is very unusual in European capitals!

Reviews.Title: “Fine location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: PeterV4
Reviews.Content: Well located just next to the U-bahn, tasteful decor and helpful staff. A little 'off the beaten track' but still in a very pleasant and quiet area. Made it part of a great Berlin experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aociardha
Reviews.Content: Never been to Berlin before, friends recommended the Hotel. It is within minutes of anywhere you would want to go. The Hotel itself is very comfortable and the staff were really helpful. Would definitely recommend the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location and value”
Reviews.Author: pmac1238
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located across the street from the subway, an ATM at the corner and within 5 minutes of major attractions - Old Berlin, Alexander Platz, Museum Island, etc. I loved that while it was close to everything, it was a little off the beaten track in a quieter area. The rooms are clean, bathrooms are good size but the bed was a little hard for me (and I like a fairly firm mattress) so if you like a softer mattress you may not get a good night sleep. The staff was amazing - so nice and helpful. Definitely a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: DDA64
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a good size but the furnishings are not ageing very well. The restaurant is a very interesting space but has a limited menu. The neighborhood is not very interesting and there aren't many restaurants around. There is a metro stop right outside the hotel. The majority of the hotel staff (but for Maria) are most friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, on several occasions the front desk was left unattended. Check-out is very slow. I doubt that I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Bob S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last April. Hotel rooms were large and very clean. Very friendly staff and service. Location is decent. Right beside an underground subway and 2 stops away from the heart of the city. Would recommend to anyone staying in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: vincentraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a week ago. The entire hotel is clean and tidy. The location is great as it is just next to U-bahn station, Märkisches Musemum, which is 2 station away from Alexandraplatz, one of the coolest area in Berlin and the drop off point of airport shuttle bus. It is quite close to the museum island and Berlin dome, from there, you can easily get a bus to Brandenburger Tor and Potsdamer Platz. The room is big enough for 2 of us with 2 large and 1 small luggages and provided with free wifi and electric kettle. The bathroom is clean, big enough and nice with shampoo, showel gel, lotion and makeup mirror. Service is okay, not having anything irritating.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Everywheretraveler
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerks were very friendly, and the room was clean and neat. With a subway station outside the hotel, it was very convenient. Overall I enjoyed my stay but I would like to have tea and coffee maker in the room. Also, I had to wait for a while every time when I tried to talk to the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay - very central”
Reviews.Author: seal_76
Reviews.Content: A short walk to the centre of Berlin, great room, not bad value and other all a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Baselitz art is great, hotel is average good.”
Reviews.Author: apaiva
Reviews.Content: Looks like an old hotel refurbished According to art'otel formula. It is nice, but I missed the extra quality and design I'd found in art'otel cologne. Restaurant is almost dead during the evening. Not really an option. Locations close to subway is great, really just a few steps from front door. Personnel is quite attent, though the breakfast personnel tried to get me enrolled in the "carlston club" Card. Why should I? Quite intrusive. This is the first time hotel employees try to enroll me into something. Price is

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic rooms in good location”
Reviews.Author: Katkuta
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not quite live up to the photos on the website. The rooms were a lot smaller and a bit more bland in reality. Having said that, if you want, clean, comfortable rooms at great value in central Berlin you can't go wrong. There are no kettles in the standard rooms, but reception lent me one when I asked. Nice touch to have a pack of gummy bears on pillow on arrival. Also complimentary roast chestnuts and apple tea in reception. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as it seemed a bit expensive (€16), however there is a lovely area of restaurants/ cafes near the river just 5-10 mins walk to the hotel. The location of the hotel is great - walking distance to Alexanderplatz and a short U-bang trip to Brandenberg Tor and other main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flateric09
Reviews.Content: A Good Hotel as the travel base for your trips throughout Berlin. Rent a bike at the Hotel and the trip into Berlin will be very good. Rooms are good and modern and the breakfast is well organized. There is no Restaurant in the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Fadihon
Reviews.Content: Got a junior suite... Was very good value and an awesome room. Very good location, clean hotel, nice staff and overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “modern, clean, great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Liza D
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin on business and switched hotels to be in this great location. The hotel is modern, clean, with a friendly staff. The location is great with shops, cafes, and resturants. close to subway and all that Berlin has to offer. I will stay at art'otel again when I am visiting Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: jens_diersen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Berlin Mitte but fairly quite ! Just a few steps away from the subway station "Märkisches Museum". It's only walking distance to Nikolaiviertel with its restaurants, cafés and beer garden. The pretty young, international service team was very friendly and professional. If you're travelling by car make a reservation for a parking space in the garage. Very limited capacity. Don't take the big cruiser as you have to take the car elevator which is pretty pokey. Anyway, a great hotel for a weekend in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - friendly comfortable and clean, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Isla T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just before christmas for a long weekend. We booked through late rooms and I emailed the hotel to let them know we were on an early flight and to see if we could leave our bags there once we arrived before check in, I also mentioned it was a special occasion. When we arrived not only was our room ready hours before we thought, we had also been upgraded. The room was really nice and spacious, very comfortable and really clean. The staff at the desk were very friendly, and helped us with everything we needed. The location was ideal for us, the metro stop is right outside the front of the hotel so you can get anywhere in Berlin really easily. We didn't eat in the hotel as it was quite expensive, however the menu looked lovely! We would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone and definitely go back here ourselves on our next trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, clean and simple rooms”
Reviews.Author: thesaint01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within a minute or two from the u-bahn (subway) station Märkisches Museum. It is also within walking distance to Museum Island, Alexanderplatz etc. so the locations is really good. Service was pretty good,arrived early but was still given the room at once.The room itself was small but clean. It is marketed as an art hotel and yes there is some art on the walls but nothing special. The rooms are further not very impressive from a design perspective but everything was clean and fairly new. I was missing coffee/tea making facilities as well as an iron and ironing board. There was further not really a good desk to work at (was ok for short periods of time). A/c was working well (but heard many other complaining so there seemed to be problems in some rooms). The bathroom was perfectly fine. The placement of the shower head was a bit strange and it the water temperature varied greatly (watch out to not burn yourself, it could go from slightly cold to scolding instantly). Did not try to breakfast as it seemed very pricey compared to having breakfast at a cafe. Staff were friendly but also slightly confused - had to spend considerable time to clarify if my pre-paid rate had actually been pre-paid. All settled after a while, and service was friendly, but could have been smoother.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lagerfeld
Reviews.Content: No complaints about this hotel, big, clean, comfy room, cheap rates for its location. If you're there to explore the city and only in for a comfy bed and a quick trip home, it's perfect. Didn't try the hotel breakfast or restaurant so can't comment on that. Free wifi. Friendly staff. Street where it's located is a bit dead but you're right next to the river and there's plenty to see up the river, walking distant to all the buzz. Underground station right outside the hotel. Only complain in general is that Mitte is not very well-lit at night so walking back to the hotel in an empty street can feel a bit dangerous...specially since there's not a lot of people walking the streets at night! But we were assured it was a really safe city so didn't get too scared.

Reviews.Title: “won't be going back!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah P
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via expedia for a 3 day break and paid in advance. When we got there they advised us they had over-booked the hotel and we had no choice but to be moved to a 'sister' hotel across the other side of the city. Whilst in the taxi to the new hotel, the driver was informed that the new hotel was also full and we were moved to a 3rd hotel. Having then wasted at least an hour of the beginning of our short weekend, we were then dumped in a not-so-nice hotel in an area we didn't want to be in - then wasted another hour and a half the next morning re-packing, checking out, getting across the city to the original hotel, checking in again, etc. The hotel was quite nice when we actually got there - but having a room (that you've paid for in advance) available to you when you get there is pretty fundamental in my book. There's no way i'd book this chain again!

Reviews.Title: “Art and style aren't enough”
Reviews.Author: philber78
Reviews.Content: Nicely decorated, nicely located hotel. But that does not compensate for bad service. When checking in, one clerk looked on while another clerk processed the line of waiting customers. The hotel promotes its restaurant, which was privatised that night for a wedding. They had set up some tables in a corner for other guests. I sat that there and waited for over 20 minutes, unable to attract the attention of the staff walking past me. Then, I gave up and walked out. Nice facilities don't make up for poorly executed basics.

Reviews.Title: “recommend without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: Contiki12375
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Art'otel with a friend for the weekend, and we both loved the hotel and found nothing to criticize. First of all it's in a great location, close to the Museumsinsel/Fischerinsel where many Spree cruises start, and literally right in front of a Metro Stop. The staff is very nice and helpful, breakfast was lovely with a great variety to chose from. We had a suite like room on the 6th floor (with a nice shared balcony) and really enjoyed the room - great clean bathroom, very comfortable beds, everything spotlessly clean and a modern coffee maker which also includes tea and hot chocolate. I'd definitely recommend the hotel for all travelers and will try to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: dmassey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Berlin for 5 nights, all at this hotel. I really can't find a single thing to even moderately criticize about our stay. Every single member of the staff was helpful, friendly and gave good recommendations. It is 20 meters from a metro stop (Berlin is far too big to attempt entirely by foot), but close enough to many of the museums that it makes for a pleasant walk. The rooms were amazingly clean, the air conditioner kept the room cool bordering on cold, and the whole place was just put together nicely. A lot of hotels try to cut the small corners thinking the guests won't notice, but this one does things the right way, from top to bottom. It was refreshing as we had just come from a hotel in Budapest that cut every corner they could, and it really showed. I would highly recommend this hotel to couples, families, and business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Elival
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days, and the overall impression was positive. Very clean room, free internet, there is a fridge/mini bar in the room, AC and nice bathrooms amenities but no conditioner. Very comfortable beds, pillows were also great and best part was that our room was very quiet, so we could sleep-in after partying unlike our previous hotel in Berlin. Very helpful customer service. The hotel is in ideal location. We walked to most places, including to all main attractions within the city of Berlin, however if walking is not your thing then there is U just metres away. Berlin public transport is wonderful, very easy to follow and very cost effective if you 3+ then buy the group ticket. Otherwise there is daily ticket which is also good value. I did not have breakfast here so I can not comment however the coffee and quiches across the street to the left, absolutely wonderful. Definitely the hotel to come back when we are in Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked”
Reviews.Author: Raymond005
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel 4 days before arrival. On arrival there were no rooms available en we were sent to a partner hotel nearby. At the partner hotel they didn't seem surpised at all. They said that in these cases they normally offer a free breakfast to the guests. It seems like the exposure of this hotel is used to get (more) guests staying in the partner hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ikea-like hotel pretending to be artsy. It was fine, though”
Reviews.Author: annaboat
Reviews.Content: The hotel had the right Euro-arty look, but ultimately felt more like Ikea. Which is really fine, but don't expect more than that. I'm an art lover, and they don't have particularly interesting art up on the walls. The rooms were clean and functional. The bathroom was tiny. It was a little awkward to take a shower (and I'm not tall or fat). The free wifi was appreciated, but it kept going down. The last night of our stay it was off for the whole hotel. The room was nice and clean. The first day the receptionist was extremely unhelpful (asked for the nearest ATM, she pointed to a closed bank that didn't have an ATM. We asked for restaurant recs, got a shrug back, with an "oh, they are all good," kind of unhelpful answer), but the receptionists to follow were all quite nice and helpful. The location was decent, right near the metro, but it was a long walk to get anywhere (Berlin is so spread out, with lots of empty space to get through). My biggest complaint was the lack of electric kettle, so I couldn't make myself a cup of tea in the morning. Luckily there is a little store almost across the street where I could find a 1 Euro cup of tea or coffee and some decent yogurt, rolls, or sandwiches for breakfast. It's a perfectly nice hotel to stay in. I just felt it lacked soul.

Reviews.Title: “All my valuables were stolen from my hotel room”
Reviews.Author: hepadoc
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin for a medical meeting, staying at the Art'otel, which was among the hotels recommended by the meeting organizers. While away for the day at the meeting, my camera, lenses, laptop, passport and briefcase were stolen from my locked hotel room. While the hotel staff on site were extremely accommodating and apologetic, the senior hotel management was only willing to reimburse less than half the $7000 replacement costs, blaming me because I had not used the hotel safe, which could not have held ANY of the stolen items except my passport. The arrogant and inflexible attitude of the senior management compounded what was already a distressing situation.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: RKNtravels
Reviews.Content: The rooms are comfortable and quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is located one minute away from a tube stop on a residential street away from tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CatalinaUD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Art'otel Berlin-Mitte in late June, and we were very comfortable. It's not a luxury hotel, but it was clean and very comfortable and it has air conditioning. The receptionists were very helpful and spoke English. More importantly, there's a U-Bahn stop right across the street and that makes sightseeing very easy. It's also within walking distance to the Nicolaiviertel and Museum Island. We would stay here again if we return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Our hotel was great!!”
Reviews.Author: Ilene47
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel at first sight, in that we landed only feet from the front door on the underground transit system and came late evening tired and hungry. So we ate in their dining room/restaurant a lovely dinner and some good wine. The front desk concierge was extremely helpful in every way orienting us as needed to transportation and directions. The room was quite nice visually and spotlessly clean, with what you would expect on the walls, good art to boot. Nice location in the heart of the Mitte where we wanted to be. Just around the corner was the Spree River and what a sight to see.

Reviews.Title: “great situation, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: freerangehen
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in a quiet street right by a u-bahn station. The hotel backs onto a canal and a small park and this side of the building is of historic interest along with its neighbours. The 'art' on the walls wasn't our cup of tea but that wasn't our main reason for choosing this hotel (price and location). The reception staff were friendly and helpful and the room was clean. Down side: The first night we ate in the hotel's restaurant. We were the only diners there which wasn't surprising as it is overpriced (7 euros for a bottle of water) but there are several restaurants nearby, the best is probably the one over the bridge, which serves German specialities. Also the mattress was rock-hard, like sleeping on a billiard table.

Reviews.Title: “Well located for exploring the former 'East' Berlin”
Reviews.Author: PamK45
Reviews.Content: Good value for money hotel in close vicinity to the river and walking distance along the river to the Museum Island area. Staff in the hotel are friendly and provide great service and there are some nice little bars and restaurants nearby. Bar area is nice and you can hire bikes for 10 euros a day from the hotel - which is a great way of exploring the city. Only downside is that the TV is all mainly German channels (well I guess it is Germany!) and you can get a bit bored with BBC World News and CNN if you are staying for a while on business.

Reviews.Title: “For gods sake, fix the heating!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BigAussieRed
Reviews.Content: To reiterate what others have said about this venue. The rooms are like a sauna 24 hours a day and now way to open the windows. I slept naked without any sheet on me and still could not sleep properly as the room was so hot!

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: brian675738
Reviews.Content: Having read mixed reviews of this hotel, we were delighted. The rooms were well proportioned and appointed. T he staff were helpful and cheerful and the breakfasts were excellent. There is provision to eat in the hotel at other times than breakfast but the menu is more like a snack bar than a restaurant. However, there are lots of eateries of all types in walking distance and the staff were helpful in pointing us in the righht direction. The location is reasonable and it is easy to get to anywhere on the public transport system We would definitely use the hotel again if returning to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: DianeHampshire
Reviews.Content: We had a really good experience at this hotel. Clean, bright, very well situated with a U Bahn metro stop right outside the door. Staff were friendly, helpful, spoke excellent English. Food in the hotel was good, and bar prices, room service prices and even mini bar prices were very reasonable for a hotel in a major city. We found the room price etc very good value for money, and its really well placed to see the major sights, pretty much all of which are in Mitte and the former East Berlin. We had a nice spacious room, well equiped with everything we needed. they will also give you a code for free wifi if you ask at reception. There are a couple of points other people have made that need answering. When you arrive, you are told that there are two breakfasts, one for about 6 euros, one for 16. The former is basically croissant sand coffee or tea, plus yoghurt I think. Everything else is the 16 euro breakfast,so if they see you eating it, they will charge you 16 euros. Its not an underhand thing, but a lot of people seemed confused by what they could and couldn't have, so check with the staff. They were all charming and helpful and spoke really good English, so no real problem. The rooms, as with most hotels, are very warm. The aircon seemed to be set to winter, and so sent out warm air when we switched it on. That just seemed to be the way it works. The windows open wide, so it wasn't a problem, but the street at the front can be noisy - its not a major road, but it is bus route, short cut, and people arrive by taxi at all times of the night. So, ask for a room at the back, or take earplugs (never travel without them, all hotels are noisy!) But all in all, a really good choice, and we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice and relaxing dinner”
Reviews.Author: CVISSER1
Reviews.Content: We had a dinner in this hotel which was really great. The taste of the food was really good and the waitress was really kind. Beautifull location as well...the Ermeler Hause is a very beautiful location if you have a party or something to celebrate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with nice suites”
Reviews.Author: smilix
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for several days and really enjoyed it. A metro-station is just around the corner, so that you can get everywhere easily. We got one of the bigger suites: really nice, but the second room ( to hold meetings??) is totally useless. Facing to the street, it's rather loud so that you can't leave the window open during the night. Nice and spacious bathroom!!! Free wifi access in the room - you have to ask for it...

Reviews.Title: “stylish, lovely place: can't fault it one iota for the price”
Reviews.Author: R_from_Melbourne
Reviews.Content: For approx 90-100 euro a night, I found art otel a true bargain. I can't think of any comparable boutique hotel in this price range, anywhere in Europe or Asia. I really don't know what some of the other reviews are complaining about, as I didn't experience any problems here. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful (they helped me with printing, scanning of documents - at no charge; they even lent me an umbrella when it was raining), and there are many delightful touches which i really loved - a delicious caramel dessert in a shot glass left for you on your first night, swanky toiletries... the breakfast spread is terrific - there are LOADS of choices. The rooms aren't very big but what do you expect for the price... The entire hotel is very stylish and very clean. Heating level was fine for my purposes. I really like the bar and restaurant, which is a great place to spend some time (and the prices are very reasonable). Like some of the other reviewers, I did experience a bit of erratic bookkeeping when it came to managing my booking (my work paid for some of the trip, so the arrangement was a bit complex...), but the problems were easily fixed with a bit of patience. I would absolutely stay here again and I certainly recommend it to anyone who wants to stay somewhere a bit different, rather than the usual generic budget/mid-range hotel -- but just bear in mind it's not a five-star place... If you want that you should cough up the euros for the Intercontinetal or whatever. If you're not a diva you'll have a great time here

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel, with unpleasant staff. AVOID!”
Reviews.Author: Dolores186338
Reviews.Content: Boiling hot rooms, with no temperature control. We asked for a refund as we could not sleep - even with the window and the fridge door open! We were told that they would authorise this through Expedia. When we got back we were told by Expedia that they would only refund 10%. This is supposed to be a 4* hotel but it seems that this issue with broken heating and no aircon has been a problem since July! The manager and other staff were underhand and dishonest and care nothing about their guests. NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “too hot hot hot! DONT EVEN TRY TO SLEEP HERE!”
Reviews.Author: dontcomeback
Reviews.Content: So the heating appears to be left on full at all times - with no aircon (apparently turned off for the winter, although previous reviews would suggest that it had given up in July at least). While outside is about 4 degrees, the inside of our room, at night, with the window open as much as we could, topped 30 degrees! And with the window open as much as we could the noise from the 'quiet street' went on from late night (taxi drop offs outside the hotel and enough passing cars to make the noise constant) to early morning (work site opposite and hotel deliveries to the hotel). It was so bad that we would have changed hotels after the first night, but the staff were dishonest about the problems - sending us off after our first night saying that they would have maintenance look at the aircon. They also told us that they would call us if they could not fix it. No call, so when we arrived back in the evening we expected the aircon to be fixed - rather than being met with a wry 'Oh, no, we do not put the aircon on in the winter. Just sleep with the window open.'! Now they are refusing to offer more than a 10% refund for a sleepless trip that was completely ruined by their thoughtless uncaring attitude. There were other gripes - smell of the bathroom, pillows, rubbish and uneaten food was left in the corridors by housekeeping for more than 24 hours... but really - there is no need for anyone to stay here for long enough to find these. It is basically not suitable as a place in which to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off - avoid”
Reviews.Author: Jimtonia
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for my stag do, 13 of us in total. I booked 3 rooms under my name. My best man did also. In the interests of writing a balanced review, I have to say that during our stay the hotel staff were friendly, rooms were good (clean, well appointed) and it is a great location for many of the attractions of the city. However, when I returned home I received a no show charge on my credit card a few weeks later. When I queried this, the hotel tried to claim I had not turned up for one of my bookings. This absolutely was not true as I could prove all my friends stayed there and had occupied rooms! There was obviously some confusion with the hotel staff when my friends checked in as we arrived at different times, but when I explained this the hotel refused to refund me and said it was their policy. They also charged a higher room rate to my friends as a result of this on checkout. They actually tried to say it was Laterooms.com policy (through which I made one of the bookings), but Laterooms confirmed that it was the hotel's decision. They also did this for one of my best man's room bookings. Totally unreasonable, particularly as we had put a lot of money in their pocket already for that weekend. I can only say best to avoid as you may pay for any misunderstandings!.

Reviews.Title: “Cool but Hot!!”
Reviews.Author: abc55Somerset
Reviews.Content: Minimalist,cool hotel in convenient location. Very friendly helpful staff. However our stay was spoilt by overheating.We could not sleep because the room was so hot,there was no facility to turn down the heating.The window opened but at such an angle that there was no movement of air. It really did spoil what is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Modern, very well located”
Reviews.Author: kev-the-puss
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the art'otel on Wall Strasse. It looks like it is newly refurbished, its on a quiet back street and backs on to the Spree Kanal and in easy walking distance of all the main sites of central Berlin - Museum island, Unter den Linden, Alexander Platz plus Mrakisches Museum U-Bahn station is right outside. The comunal areas are very pleasant and modern in style and an art gallery feel. We ate in the hotel restaurant the first evening as we were tired from travelling and walking the city, the menu is small but the food is good, you can find better value if you venture out and find a restaurant though. Nikolai-viertel is close by which has several restaurants, we ate in Gasthaus Zur Rippe, 17 Post Strasse, which was a traditional German place with hearty meals and good beer at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed and good value”
Reviews.Author: 2infintyandbeyond10
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel to be excellent in just about every way, location good, room was clean of good size and really inviting. Staff were really helpful and friendly. Cannot fault the hotel at all. The Nikolaiviertel area with bars and restaurants is about a 10-15 minute walk with good options and value.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Orkaem
Reviews.Content: I travelled on July to Berlin for holidays with friends and stayed at art'otel for 6 nights. Pros: Great location, near to everything and major sightings in walking distance. Plus, there is a metro station right outside the front door which is good when you carry shopping bags or had to drink a glass more! And we didn't spent as much as other same category hotels require. The room was clean and if you are a smoker, there is a small opening right across the main entrance where you can smoke your cigarette and have coffee from the hotel bar. We didn't pay for breakfast, but there are lots of places around from where you can get coffee and a sandwich at reasonable prices. Cons: Airconditioning was a mess. We were unlucky enough to visit Berlin when the temperature reached 40oC and the hotel room at nights was like an oven... Well, there wasn't airconditioning not even in shops so we didn't complain about it. Other from our group who complained, got there room changed the same day. Also, if you plan to print something or use the common computer by the reception, be prepaired to pay a ridiculous amount of money!!!! Nevertheless, I recommend this hotel and I will use again next time I am in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to think of any shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: Esskaywe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the Museum Island (within walking distance). Although a little far from the Reichstag and the Brandenburg gate area, but easy connectivity is ensured owing to a U-bahn station close-by. The hotel itself has very good rooms (atleast for single occupancy) and courteous and helpful reception and service staff (well-versed in English). The modern-art styling sprang up in places, but without any overkill. Breakfast was absolutely smashing and indeed gave a bright start to the day!! Strong and free wifi internet in the rooms was also a positive thing.

Reviews.Title: “Screwed up our booking”
Reviews.Author: jctomas
Reviews.Content: We arrived here exhausted from Venice after a week of travelling through Italy, thinking we'd paper ourselves at this place, which looks great online. But no, our 6th-floor junior suite with balcony, booked several months ahead, wasn't available. Instead, we were placed into a poxy little room on the second floor overlooking the local crackhouse. And no, there was nothing they could do about it. It's a computer error. No der. To add to the fun, the bathrooms, while designed artistically, leak water all over the floor when you shower. The safe was broken and would only be repaired once we'd left, and the wifi is so weak as to be better in my home country, Australia, where we call broadband fraudband. We fruitlessly tried to find somewhere else to stay but gave up, caving in to exhaustion and the doeful looks from staff. How this place has 4 stars is beyond me. If you brave booking here, ring beforehand and triple check since they clearly don't check the booking confirmation they send you.

Reviews.Title: “I Will recommand this Hotel to all m'y...”
Reviews.Author: Marcsaigon
Reviews.Content: I Will recommand this Hotel to all m'y friends ! Tks Mathias and his staff for the warm and friendly athmospher of the Hotel ! Plus a very convenient location ! We spend 5 excellent days ! Marc from Saigon

Reviews.Title: “Nonfunctioning A/C is no joke in a heat wave”
Reviews.Author: traveler14tx
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here one night in July 2010 during a heat wave in which the temperature in our 4th-floor apartment reached 95F. My partner called ahead to ensure that the hotel had air conditioning and that it was functioning. The hotel answered "yes" to both. We arrived and found the room almost the same temperature as the air outside the hotel. We made sure to adjust the thermostat properly, then went to dinner. We came back 90 minutes later and the room was not noticeably cooler than when we left. We called the front desk and they were no help. We are too tired to switch hotels and we feel completely ripped off. I would also like to add that the free Wifi is problematic -- you can only use one device at a time. I got online using my iPhone for a few minutes, then turned off the Wifi and tried to log on using my laptop. No matter what I did, the WiFi service would tell me that I had exceeded the maximum number of users. Will not be returning to this wretched place.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Museum Island”
Reviews.Author: MymAustralia
Reviews.Content: We've now stayed here twice. It's a very good base for getting to the major museums. There's an U-bahn station just outside which makes it easy to get around to other parts of the city (the Berlin Welcome Card is very useful for this). The rooms and bathroom are well laid out. On the first visit we had a top floor with a small terrace which we very much liked, even if only for standing with a glass of wine in hand in the evening, but the last visit was a very short notice and these were not available. We booked a suite lower down. We had expected (without checking) this would give a separate lounge area but rather it gave a work/dining area which wasn't much use to us at this time. The breakfast area could be much more efficient than it is. Even the "Express Breakfast" isn't fast although some simple process improvements would solve much of the problem. We had a rental car on our first visit and the garage experience was rather nerve-wracking. I wouldn't want to do it in a large vehicle. It seems that the empty old government building across the street is about to be turned into apartments so I'd be concerned about it perhaps being a building site sometime late 2010 and in 2011. That might also change the outlook, depending on the building height.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: skymoo
Reviews.Content: No complaints, apart from the scribbles in our room that passed for art, they were laughable. Very quiet room (thick walls). Very friendly and helpful reception desk. Choice of breakfast from an extortionate 16euro to a cheaper 5euro. Plenty of cafes in area to get breakfast. Bar and restaurant look nice but deserted when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “No airconditioning for 4 days... isn't that great ?!”
Reviews.Author: AssafHA
Reviews.Content: Hotel like this shoud take care of its maintenance and not provide stupid answers like "they will fix it on monday.... the maintenance people were here all week..." bottom line - did not fix the problem

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bejoerg
Reviews.Content: Secound year I stayed here under the ITB. Nice hotel and friendly staff. Nothing really special, but perfect for business. Very central location and close to everything. Rooms are spacious and clean. Staff is excellent and very helpful. Breakfast is ok, but not great. A good hotel that gives you what you need. Free internett is a pluss, but a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “A solid property”
Reviews.Author: greece4ever
Reviews.Content: We had a quick stay at Art'otel Berlin Mitte, and found it ok for the price paid, although we must admit we have stayed in better properties for the same amount of money in Berlin. It is considered as the best Art'Otel in Berlin, and in terms of service and lobby/reception area it is, but the rooms might have been more nicely decorated to qualify for a 4 star hotel. The rooms are ok, but what let us down was the bathrooms, which were cheaply done, and they did not even have a proper shower space. For a one night stay it does its job well, but for 4-5 nights, I would have stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great place”
Reviews.Author: Joseatoro
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for a long weekend trip to Berlin. The hotel is very well situtated, in the middle of everything, but in a quiet street. Hence, you have a very good sleep. There is a subway station on the corner, and the main landmarks are just five blocks away. We booked without breakfast, the hotel offered an express breakfast for just €5.80 it was a good choice. Clean, comfortable, and well designed room. Nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “A very smart hotel in a nice, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Intermanaut
Reviews.Content: After a rather enjoyable flight with Lufthansa and a very easy transfer from Tegel airport by bus and ubahn, we arrived in a very quiet, almost deserted Wallstrasse. Besides the Australian Embassy and a couple of other hotels, it looks like there's not a great deal in this part of the city. The hotel is within 50m of two entrances to the ubahn, so it's very easy to get to and from, even with luggage. Check-in was quick and painless. Although I can speak some German I'm not yet capable of anything more than a few pleasantries, giving my name, etc, so to be greeted in English by a charming (and rather attractive) young lady who proceeded to spend several minutes showing us where we were in relation to the key sites and sights was extremely welcoming. The hotel room allocated over-looked Wallestrasse. At the time it wasn't a particularly attractive view - just the street and a new apartment development across the road. However, the room was very spacious with all the facilities one expects in a hotel of this style: wireless internet, TV, air conditioning, mini-bar, desk, armchairs and so on, and an excellent shower - very important if, like me, you have a crummy shower at home! Using this hotel as a base for sight-seeing is easy. From the ubahn stop you can be anywhere in the city within 30 minutes, and setting off by foot you can be at the Brandenburg Gate within half-an hour. Heading out for the evening on foot and you can cross the canal to find some nice little bars and restaurants, as well as some boutique shops. At less than £90 per room per night, this hotel represents excellent value for money, especially when compared to similar hotels in Paris and London.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: heyhey49Scotland
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for Alexander Platz and Potsdamer Platz as Underground station very close with direct line to both. Lovely room, excellent breakfast and friendly service. Few restaurants nearby, though Shezan in Roßstraße not bad Indian one. (Only minus for me was pathetic pillow!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: GilbertoAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Artotel Berlin Mitte is just a good hotel with friendly staff, nice rooms and good beds. We chose it because of the price and the location. Alhough it is not in the trendiest, busiest neighbourhood, it is close to everything. We went to the museum island (1 km), Kreuzberg and Prenzlauer Berg (both 2km), the Jewish Museum (1 km), Friedrichstrasse (1 km) etc.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel (and all other Park Plaza hotels) at all cost”
Reviews.Author: USAussieLondon
Reviews.Content: After a late night flight we turned up at the art'otel looking forward to collapsing into a cozy bed but much to our dismay we were told that although we booked a room over 3 months prior the hotel was full and they had no room for us! We specifically booked this hotel on the recommendation of a local as it is close to public transport and in a good location for first-time visitors to Berlin to base themselves. He hotel located a room for us in another hotel and paid for our taxi there but it was in a much (emphasis on "much") less desirable part of Berlin and about a 15 minute walk to the nearest train station. I am not going to say this ruined our trip but it came close! Steer away from any hotel owned by Park Plaza. I certainly will from now on! Not wanting to only leave negative comments, I will commend the front desk clerk for handling himself very professionally through the entire ordeal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in quiet neighbourhood yet close to city center”
Reviews.Author: MaxGS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the art'otel berlin-mitte for 4 nights in July 2009. We selected this hotel on the basis of its great reviews and its location and we were not disappointed. We were immediately impressed by the stylish design of the hotel and the friendliness and professionalism of staff (all English-speaking). Our room was spacious, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was clean (though smallish with shower only) and the selection at breakfast was plentiful (great variety, good quality). The hotel is located in a quiet area, very close to the south tip of the Museum Island. Using the U-bahn was extremely easy since Markisches Museum station is just outside the hotel. Also, the staff at reception were happy to call a taxi for us and it always got there in a matter of minutes - just enough time to enjoy the rocking chairs at the reception area! Room service was satisfactory; we made use of it a couple of nights to have a late dinner in our room (there are no restaurants or cafeterias in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, so we had no choice but to dine in or head for the city center). Overall, our stay at the art'otel berlin-mitte was very enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “New, fresh and modern design. Strongly recommendable!”
Reviews.Author: Kent_o_Sigrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the art'otel Berlin Mitte. The U-Bahn station is located right outside the building. With a connecing bus (X9) you get all the way to/from Berlin Tegel within 45 minutes and just 2,10 Euro (single trip p.p.). You can also reach many of the city's attractions from this U-Bahn station (called: Märkisches Museum) with good frequency even at late hours. When we opened the door to our room, we were almost infatuated by the wightness of the design - wow! We got this room by using SAS Gold points. The room was rather large, loacted at the top floor and had access to a balcony. The room was designed in a modern fashion and offered a feeling of luxury with bathrobe and slippers,coffee machine, sleep-well-sweets (cute ones) etc. Everything felt very new, fresh and clean. The berakfast offered a good choice for everyone. Coffe was served at the table. The service was good. If you were still missing something you could always ask for it and they would try to comply. In our case tha breakfast was included, but otherwise, I heard, that it was rather expensive. Nice staff. Relatively central, but quite location. A short walk to some of the many attractions like Alexanderplatz, Pergamon museum, Unter den Linden (all within 15 min walk) and otherwise there is always the U-Bahn (direct connection to the Zoologischer Garten). A good Indian restaurant with lunch for 5,90 Euro between 11 - 16 is located at the river just around the corner. More local pubs are close by to the river. We would stay here again and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Dumont78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal for the price. The rooms were really clean and beds comfortable with modern decor. The bathrooms were nice, but no bathtub, only a shower. The in-room Wifi was typically expensive, but you can get free service in the lobby. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. As for the surrounding area of the hotel, there's not a lot going on, but it is very centrally located so you can get to most places in the city very easily. There's an U-bahn stop right out front.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Comfortable, Good location & Very Quiet”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterEurotourer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in November 2008. We had a twin room that was quite spacious and everything that you would expect from an average 4 star. Beds were very comfortable and the hotel was very quiet both inside and out. Alexanderplatz was an easy 10 minute walk away so we thought location good. Even better was that there was a U-Bahn staiton right outside the hotel so if you were travelling across the city it was dead easy. I have to say that although my room was spacious, some friends paid exactly the same but their room was somewhat smaller. The only downside was breakfast @ 13euro pp I thought it was expensive and not really worth the money however if I was to visit Berlin again (although I won't) I would stay there again/

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: Nykohler
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through a recommendation, but was pretty disappointed. Location wasn't amazing (slightly puzzled by previous reviews!), and for the cost I could easily have booked a more stylish, better quality hotel. Having said that it was only 10 mins walk to Alexanderplatz and plenty going on up there! Although it was nice, it felt as though everything was done on the cheap, and that they were trying to claw every penny out of guests; wifi and hotel meals v expensive. Staff, whilst friendly and helpful didn't seem particularly organised, and there was confusion with staff trying to charge us 32euros for a couple of croissants and make us pay twice for the room! At all in all, OK but could do much better!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Spacious & Central”
Reviews.Author: EnEx
Reviews.Content: Our perfect hotel is one that offers a central location to the attractions we want to see - with spacious, comfortable rooms and good service. art'otel, Mitte in Berlin definitely fulfilled these requirements. Our room (superior double) was very spacious and extremely comfortable - with a bath for relaxing those tired walking muscles. The onsite restuarant was also excellent - supported by good advice on local eating establishments when we wanted to venture out. The Hotel is less than 1/2 block from the closest U Bhan station - but is situated in a quiet street. Walking time to many sights (Unter den Linden, Gendarmenmakt, Deutches Museum, Checkpoint Charlie, Nikolaivertel etc. was less than 15 minutes - while virtually everything else was easily accessible by U-Bahn, starting almost next door.

Reviews.Title: “superb, comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: silver_squirrel
Reviews.Content: Initially we were apprehensive about booking with a “boutique-style” hotel, being a semi retired couple in our mid 50’s, but the price and location were ideal for our purposes. Upon arrival we were greeted by a young male receptionist who immediately made us feel at home. Being early evening, we were concerned at finding a nearby restaurant for our meal. He immediately supplied us with maps indicating the most suitable areas for a choice of restaurants and the type of cuisine to be expected. The hotel is modern and functional. Although the facilities may initially appear to be simplistic, nothing is omitted and the beds were some of the most comfortable experienced. I would highly recommend this hotel and will certainly stay again should I revisit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “classy city hotel”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter77Uk
Reviews.Content: This city hotel is in a good location. Restaurants not far, lots to see and do. The hotel itself is very nice, clean, minimalist and our room was very nice. The rooms are colour themed and you can request a colour! We were more interested in requesting a balcony room, however, as it was August and we wanted to spend a couple of evenings with a beer outside. The hotel accommodated us for this. The staff on reception were also very helpful in giving us information about restaurants and also telling us that some closed at certain times, thereby saving us a walk. It's worth asking them, as they were all very knowledgeable about the area. We had a lovely few days here - Berlin was great and we really recommend this hotel for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Anazus
Reviews.Content: I'm way back with this review! I stayed for 3 days at the art'otel berlin-mitte in early May, in a working trip. My overall feelings about the hotel are positive, though I would have expected something special from a 'boutique' hotel. ROOM: My room was good sized, the bathroom was ok with a nice shower and a great hair drier (I have long hair and it was pouring rain while I was there, so it became quite useful). Even though the room had a big window, the view was... a wall! Of course I wasn't to stay at my room all day but it was deceiving to face a wall first thing in the morning. Details were really what most bothered me: shutters had little holes, the shower had a broken tile and curtains looked a bit tired. Again, nothing really important except that I had supposedly paid for a 'design' hotel. HOTEL/STAFF: The architecture of building is quite nice. The breakfast room is beautiful, with lots of light and a nice decoration (the breakfast itself is once again just ok - even a bit overpriced if not for the great service). The staff was very attentive, they all spoke very good english and were very efficient. AREA: When I booked the hotel, I had the idea it was a little more central than it ended up being (it was my first time in Berlin) but there's a metro station right out the hotel, as well as bus stops (that I've never used). The area is very calm, mostly residential. Getting back in the evening by myself was weird, the street would be dark and desert - but I never felt unsafe in any way. As said before, I didn't disliked the hotel. It's just nothing special for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but a bit boring”
Reviews.Author: martindka
Reviews.Content: The location was good, there is nothing around the hotel, which makes it a boring area, but it's just beside the subway, with easy access to all of Berlin. The rooms, cleanliness etc. were of a high standard.. but I somehow missed a little 'noise' around the hotel, everything was a little too quiet... it was lacking some charm, maybe this will come over the years. We didn't have breakfeast at the hotel, but there is a nice small bakery just nearby, where you can eat breakfeast with fresh juice etc. if you don't like noise at all, when you have to sleep this is for you... I couldn't sleep it was too quiet :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for UBahn, Good value with a deal”
Reviews.Author: pmlinc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 50m from a UBahn station which makes up for the fact there are not a lot of bars etc in the immediate vicinity. We found it very easy to go a few stops on the UBahn to a more lively area especially as the U2 line runs until 12:45 on weekdays and 0300 on a Saturday night. There is a corner shop 50m away for drinks etc at a fraction of the minibar rates. Australians may find it useful to note that the hotel is next door to the Australian Embassy and there is also an "Australian shop" a few doors a way. The hotel itself was of a good standard without being too over the top. One very useful feature we dont get in the UK much at this budget was aircon which was vital bearing in mind the windows could not be opened due to mosquitos from the nearby river. The only negative point was the bathroom which did not have enough ventilation leading to an equatorial feel for an hour after someone had showered. The shower was also badly designed so that it flooded the bathroom floor no matter how the curtain was positioned. The overall standard was very similar to a uk Travelinn. We got a deal and paid around £60 per night which was good value. We didnt eat at the hotel as the menus looked very expensive and we preferred to eat on the go whilst sightseeing. We found it is best to shop around as there is widely varying value for food in Berlin. The best way to travel around the city is to get the 3 day welcome card. Our advice is to get the ticket from a machine which speaks english as there are a number of similar but different tickets and it is easy to get the wrong one from a non-english speaking advisor in a station info centre. You can then pick up the voucher book from a station info centre when passing. Make sure you get the right type of info centre though as we queued at several (There seems to be seperate ones for the UBahn SBahn and normal trains) getting blank looks before finding the right one (the SBahn). Obviously the best thing is to make the effort to learn some German!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Teutonic67
Reviews.Content: Having previously enjoyed a great week's stay at the sister art'otel in Berlin (the Warhol-themed City Centre West), we decided to book a 4-night stay at this hotel so we could visit more of the sights on the eastern side of the city. The difference was stark. This hotel is located in a very quiet district - barely a passing car on a weekday, completely dead at the weekendand with no local facilities. The one bar round the corner had one old pensioner propping the bar up on a Friday evening. The hotel itself is already showing signs of age. The fixtures and fittings in the room were tired and worn; edges of shelves worn away, carpets badly stained, window blinds torn and damaged. The room was very much smaller than in the sister hotel, though the bed was amply sized as in all German hotels. Only one almost useless pillow per person though (think no thicker than a cracker) and no availability of additional bed linen as most other hotels would normally provide. The room was effectively air conditioned (i.e. you could control temperature and speed yourself) and this is essential as the hotel's proximity to a very still tributary to the Spree means that the area is plagued by large, voracious mosquitoes. Leaving your bedroom window open is not an option as my heavily bitten body will testify! During my stay I needed to use the internet in order to check-in for our return flight. The cost of using the solitary PC in the lobby was extortionate. Given the low cost of internet access and PC hardware, all decent hotels now offer such 'business centre' services for free - here, it was a credit card driven system charging 1Euro for 3 minutes online time and extra for every printed page. As a general tip, if you need to use the internet whilst in Berlin, look up the Easy Internet cafes before you go, there's a huge one in Kurfurstendam and at least one more I saw elsewhere - there access costs 1 Euro for an hour! Overall, the stay at Berlin Mitte was not what I expected from a hotel chain which calls its most basic room 'Superior'. It needs to decide whether it wants to be 'designer' or just a smart hostel. For UK travellers, the room was the same size and in the same condition as you'd find in a Travelodge. If you expect no more than that, you won't be disappointed. Also, if you're the kind of person who likes to step out of their hotel and straight into the action, this won't ring your bell as all destinations will require at least a half hour walk or public transport journey.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location, poor bathroom design”
Reviews.Author: olimaspecto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a priceline rate of about $70/night so I cannot complain too much. The hotel is relatively convenient when arriving by train, though you generally have to switch lines to get here. Luckily the hotel is very close to a U Bahn line so its easy to get around. Check-in was fine and the staff spoke pretty good English. Hallways and public areas were decorated nicely, albeit perhaps a bit unique. The room was small, but fine for a two night stay. Wished the beds would have been a bit more substantial, but my worst complaint is on the bathroom. There was no "lip" to the shower so the water ran into the bathroom as well, since it was just separated by a relatively thin curtain. This could have just been our room but my guess is its relatively common in the design. I would stay here again, but only if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Damning with Faint Praise”
Reviews.Author: GiveMeMORE
Reviews.Content: We were attracted to the hotel because of its design, and as far as the restaurant, bar, breakfast went - it was lovely. But the design in the bathrooms - not lovely. First we stayed in a smallish room with an impossible to adjust shower. Then we upgraded to a bigger and better room where the faucets were so poorly placed that even washing your hands was uncomfortable. In the budget room there was no shampoo in the bathroom - you had to go downstairs to ask for it, and the information regarding hotel services had been copied on a copier which was obviously running out of ink. The hotel is part of the Park Plaza chain, and yet the bathrooms and instructions made you feel like you were staying in a youth hostel. The great breakfast nearly made up for it, but... you can find better in Berlin. As for location, yes, it is directly across from a subway station, but so are lots of hotels and this one isn't part of a busy line - you can wait for that subway for a long time... We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great City, good hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: The_Rochdalien
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night, Saturday, for a Valentines get away. The Hotel is in a nice quiet street, it is clean, well presented with helpful, friendly staff who spoke very good english. We did not try the food. The location is perfect, the U Bahn is outside with single trips for 1.20 Euro. We walked easliy to Checkpoint Charlie, then Potzdammer platz and Brandenburg Gate. Alexanderplatz and a section of old town are nearby with some excellent drinking and eating venues. We would go back for a longer stay if in Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JohnJF
Reviews.Content: A good location, right by an u-bahn station, easily walkable to the Alessandra Platz (where we took our breakfast, not wanting to pay 15 Euro each in the hotel), the Nikolei Viertal (lovely area), and even to "Unter dem Linden". The u-bahn will also take you easily to the Stadtmitte (a short walk to checkpoint charlie) or Potzdamer Platz for the holocaust museum. The hotel is modern, décor spartan but functional. Staff very friendly and helpful, the rooms more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: SleepingWombat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easy to find, in a great location next to the U-bahn, was clean, safe and quiet, and was great value. The rooms were a good size, while not being large, which we pretty much expected and the staff friendly. Have to say though, the rooms are a good size by London standards. The hotel is only a short walk from Museum Island and is on the U2 underground line (U-bahn). To get there from Schonefeld airport, simply catch the S9 (surface train) from the airport and get off at Alexanderplatz, then change to the U2 line heading towards Ruhleben and get off after two stops at Museum Markt. You will see the hotel when you get up the stairs. The U2 goes to many locations and is safe to use well into the night. Cost for 2 hour AB zone ticket is 2.10 euro, which you can also use from the airport, (makes trip to the hotel great value). There after, we bought a day ticket (AB zone again) for 5.60 euro each, which allowed us to get on and off the U-bahn and S-bahn all day without worrying about tickets. (don't forget to validate your ticket in yellow 'box' after buying it). At the end of the street is a deli run by a nice couple who make takeaway latte's for 2 euro and have nice pastries for about 1.60 each. We had these for breakfast in our room before heading out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun - trendy room - mildy dodgy!”
Reviews.Author: Bibliothecarius
Reviews.Content: Very trendy and stylish hotel in apparently remote area but in fact only minutes from city centre by S-Bahn. Very comfortable rooms full of modern art and trendy modern furniture. Magnificent bathroom, but minimalist glass walls initially slightly embarrassing for two male friends sharing - we just had to chill out and get over it. Hotel adult channel the best have ever seen - sorry - we were on a stag weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Mediocre Value!”
Reviews.Author: toni.lister
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed here for 3 nights on our recent month-long trip around Europe. We arrived at the hotel in the evening & were checked in without any hassles. We thought it was in a bit of a commercial-type area, without any local shops as such, but it was within seconds of the metro, & within easy distance of many attractions around Berlin. Our room was fairly large with huge double-glazed windows looking out onto the street. The air conditioning was provided at no extra change, & the beds (two singles pushed together to make a king) were very comfortable. There was a mini-bar, TV two desks, a wardrobe & a counter for your baggage. The bathroom was large-ish, with a wheelchair friendly shower. It was all quite nice, if a little anaemic. It seemed more like a business-orientated hotel, although the staff did their best to help us with directions & the like. The restaurant & bar were a bit pricey, but there was a cool 'outdoor bar' - an indoor area without a roof, so you could actually sit in the sun - see it to believe it. There was also an internet computer in the lobby but you can only access it by using your credit card details. We scored this room through a website that was offering cheap rooms at the time (I guess empty rooms don't make money) - while I thought we received exceptional value for money (we had a superior room too & it was still ridiculously cheap), when we saw the price that the room usually was, we just about died of shock - I cannot imagine paying that much for what it was, although I am sure that we would have stuck to budget rather than location if that had been the case. We enjoyed our stay there a lot, but it would have been nice if breakfast was included (you could buy it separately but it was also pricey). Recommended for those with a high budget unless you can get a deal!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced but Stylish”
Reviews.Author: chrisny2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremely clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. My room was average sized for European standards. The shower was quite small and there was no bathtub. Internet access here was very expensive: 25 Euros per 24 hours. The front desk staff was always willing to provide excellent tourist advice and maps. The art theme of the hotel added a stylish touch to a very reasonably priced hotel. A subway station was directly in front of the hotel, providing easy access to city sights as well as Tegel Airport. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: robert240
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very modern and sleek. Beautiful, well-laid out, albeiit small rooms. Fantastic breakfast with an incredible selection of meats, cheeses, yogurts, breads etc. And, as a non-German speaker, the staff were uber-helpful. Great location in front of a u-bahn stop.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Neighborhood..Convenient to U-bahn”
Reviews.Author: jojooboo
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for two nights in April 2006. As others have mentioned, there isn't much happening around this hotel day or night, but everything in Berlin is easily reachable using public transportation. The U-bahn stop Märkisches Museum on the U2 line is literally right under the street (Wallstrasse) outside the hotel with easy connections a couple stops away at Alexander Platz to other U and S-bahn lines you can use to explore the city. Traveling the other direction (toward Ruhleben) will allow you to visit Checkpoint Charlie (Stadmitte station) and Potzdamer Platz where you can also connect to the S-bahn and further on is the Olympic Stadium. Our room was spacious (for Europe) and the bathroom was very nice. Two twin beds could be combined to make a king bed and the window opened for some fresh air. Everything looked rather new. The hallway lights are operated by motion, which was a bit startling when we left early in the morning to catch our flight. We had to wave our arms out the door to get the lights to come on. We flew into Berlin-Schönefeld and purchased a 2 day pass for all trains for around 15 Euro. We took the S-bahn to Alexanderplatz and transferred to the U-bahn to reach the hotel. We definitely got our money's worth using the 2 day pass as we explored Berlin extensively taking in Checkpoint Charlie, the Olympic Stadium, the Reichstag, Brandenburg Gate, the East Side Gallery, the Ku'damm, Kaiser-Wilhelm-Gedächtnis-Kirche, Berliner Dom, the Fernsehturm, and Sachsenhausen concentration camp in Oranienburg (reachable via the S1) among others. All of the sites we saw with the exception of Sachsenhausen are in the A or B zone, but if you want to visit further out make sure you get an ABC ticket. It is only a Euro or two more to do this if you do it up front. We ate at the hotel restaurant one night when we were just too tired to find anything else. It was a pleasant experience and the food was excellent. English language menus were available and the atmosphere is quite nice. For other meals we ate near Alexander Platz at a Brewpub and also several times at Hackescher Markt (Hackescher Hof has great breakfasts and there is an "American" type restaurant that even sold nachos connected to the S-bahn station), reachable by several S-bahn lines from Alexander Platz. You can even find the biggest Starbucks I've ever seen there if you can't go without your daily dose. About the only problem we experienced at the Art'Otel was that the internet wi-fi was down as was the internet from the computer in the lobby (both are pay services). Since we had planned to "phone home" using Skype, this threw a wrench in our plans but I understood it to be more of an issue of the internet provider than of the hotel itself. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it if you don't want to spend the big bucks for something near the more popular parts of the city. Since you can get there easily using public transport, save your money for some beer!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but...”
Reviews.Author: txsunshine06
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Art 'otel in Berlin Mitte last weekend. We found this hotel to be overpriced. Breakfast was 14 Euro, which would have been nice if it were included in the price of the room. There was nothing really special about this hotel. Be prepared to walk through a cloud of smoke every time you arrive and depart the hotel. I live in Germany and expect the smoke, but this was a little ridiculous. The location was great as we took public transportation everywhere and the UBahn was right outside the hotel. The room was clean and the personnel were very friendly. There was a convention in Berlin so the hotels all over Berlin were completely booked. Only in this situation would I consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, decent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. Very modern with nice ammenities and very central. It's directly across from the U2 train stop. Only complaint is that the neighborhood doesn't have much to offer in the way of entertainment, eating, coffee houses or pubs. If you want to stay in the action they have locations on the Ku'damm.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights and were excited over the art and the friendliness of the staff. Simple but very nice rooms. VERY friendly staff at the restaurant and the reception (very helpfull) Good atmosphere overall. Subway station right in front of the hotel with direct line to all the mayor sights and locations. A place to recommend to best friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected but not bad value”
Reviews.Author: bjg1
Reviews.Content: Beware self-proclaimed 'hip boutique' hotels with slick websites. Art'otel is a relatively basic hotel masquerading as a luxury/trendy one. On the plus side, the lobby and restaurant areas are very well designed and pleasant areas to hang out in: the breakfast buffet is also quite good. On the minus side, the rooms are quite small and basic and beginning to fade a little too quickly for a relatively new hotel. I stayed in a junior suite, which was just about the size of an average hotel room for a four star, and was perfectly adequate, but nothing special. The hotel's main selling point is its excellent location, within easy and pleasant walking distance of the sights of Mitte and with a beautifully restored early 20th C. U-Bahn station (subway) just outside the door. They also offer relatively good weekend deals, so let's not be too negative!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing with a good location”
Reviews.Author: Chris75
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights recently at the Artotel Berlin Mitte. It was supposed to be a designer hotel, I have searched for the design, but I haven't found any kind of design in the rooms. May be the restaurant have something, but the rooms are poorly decorated, with common furniture. The bed was not very comfortable. In the bathroom there is only liquid soap with two small towels. Do not expect any kind of luxury at Artotel Berlin Mitte, it is only a basic hotel, but with a convenient location (50 meters from the metro, 2 metro stations from Alexander platz). The breakfast was good and the staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Too Fabulous For Its Own Good”
Reviews.Author: Crabbus
Reviews.Content: Directly across the street from an informal bus terminus the hotel is also very convenient for the U-Bahn into town and some points in the East on foot, but quite a walk away from the heart of things. The staff was friendly and tried to be accomodating, but couldn't give me a non-smoking room for the first night, nor an internal room, and I was woken by the early morning firing up of the local bus service (a courtyard-facing room is essential unless you have industrial strength earplugs.) The rooms are small and ill-conceived. Too much attention on 'fabulousness' throughout the hotel (the public spaces are sleek and unwelcoming) and not enough on basic guest comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Probably Not Your Best Choice”
Reviews.Author: JamesV79
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Berlin, so we were unfamiliar with the city layout. But we were drawn to the design of the Art'otel. Yes, the public spaces are nicely designed, as are the rooms. But the rooms are small and not very functional. And the location is definitely out of the way (although there is an U-bahn station just a half block away). And we were really put off by the tourist buses and groups. Not really our scene. If you do end up here, be sure to specify a room at the back of the hotel. The ones on the front are very noisy.
